actions.actionTitle: Remediate risky OAuth apps
actions.actionDescription: Identify and remediate OAuth applications that have been granted excessive permissions or show risky behavior patterns in your environment. This involves reviewing OAuth consent grants in Azure AD and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps to detect potentially malicious or overprivileged applications.

actions.actionTitle: Generate and view operational report providing app install status
actions.actionDescription: Generate reports from Microsoft Intune to track application installation status across managed devices. These reports provide visibility into deployment success rates, installation failures, and device compliance with application requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Generate and review reports for device compliance
actions.actionDescription: Create and regularly review device compliance reports in Microsoft Intune to ensure devices meet organizational security requirements. These reports help identify non-compliant devices and track remediation efforts across your device fleet.

actions.actionTitle: Configure retention period for deleted users in a shared drive
actions.actionDescription: Set retention policies for data belonging to deleted users in shared drives and OneDrive for Business. This ensures that important data is preserved for compliance and business continuity even after user accounts are removed from the organization.

actions.actionTitle: Generate and review reports for device compliance trends
actions.actionDescription: Analyze historical device compliance data through Microsoft Intune to identify trends and patterns in compliance violations. These trend reports help predict potential security issues and optimize compliance policies based on historical data.

actions.actionTitle: Monitor groups access
actions.actionDescription: Implement access reviews and monitoring for Azure AD groups to ensure appropriate membership and permissions. This includes regular review of group owners, members, and access rights to maintain the principle of least privilege.

actions.actionTitle: Turn on idle session timeout
actions.actionDescription: Configure automatic session timeout policies for idle users in Azure AD and Microsoft 365 applications. This security measure helps prevent unauthorized access when users leave their workstations unattended by automatically signing them out after a period of inactivity.

actions.actionTitle: Manually update remote devices
actions.actionDescription: Perform manual updates on remote devices through Microsoft Intune when automatic updates are not suitable or immediate patching is required. This allows administrators to push critical security updates to specific devices or groups on demand.

actions.actionTitle: Enable remote help for tenants
actions.actionDescription: Enable Microsoft Remote Help to provide secure remote assistance to users while maintaining compliance and audit trails. This feature allows IT administrators to remotely view and control devices with proper authentication and user consent.

actions.actionTitle: Configure indicators for IPs and URLs/domains
actions.actionDescription: Create custom indicators of compromise (IoCs) in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint by specifying malicious IPs, URLs, and domains. These indicators help detect and block known threats across your environment automatically.

actions.actionTitle: Detect new OAuth applications connected to your corporate environment
actions.actionDescription: Monitor and detect newly connected OAuth applications accessing corporate data through Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. This continuous monitoring helps identify shadow IT and potentially risky third-party applications gaining access to organizational resources.

actions.actionTitle: Manage on-premises application provisioning
actions.actionDescription: Configure and manage user provisioning for on-premises applications through Azure AD Application Proxy and provisioning agents. This enables automated user lifecycle management for legacy applications that don't support modern authentication protocols.

actions.actionTitle: Disable browser persistence
actions.actionDescription: Configure browser session policies to prevent persistent browser sessions in Azure AD, requiring users to re-authenticate after closing their browser. This reduces the risk of unauthorized access from shared or public computers.

actions.actionTitle: Manage end-user experiences for applications
actions.actionDescription: Customize and control how end users interact with enterprise applications through the My Apps portal and application launcher. This includes configuring application visibility, access permissions, and self-service capabilities for better user experience and security.

actions.actionTitle: Collect and analyze information about cyber threats
actions.actionDescription: Enable threat intelligence collection and analysis through Microsoft 365 Defender and Azure Sentinel to proactively identify emerging threats. This includes aggregating threat data from multiple sources and correlating it with your environment's security telemetry.

actions.actionTitle: Run simulation attacks
actions.actionDescription: Conduct phishing simulation campaigns using Microsoft Defender for Office 365's Attack Simulation Training. These simulations help assess user awareness and identify vulnerable users who need additional security training.

actions.actionTitle: Require mobile devices to lock upon inactivity
actions.actionDescription: Configure device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune to enforce automatic screen locks after a period of inactivity on mobile devices. This prevents unauthorized access to corporate data on unattended mobile devices.

actions.actionTitle: Detect misuse of privileged role access
actions.actionDescription: Monitor and detect anomalous activities by privileged accounts using Azure AD Privileged Identity Management (PIM) and Identity Protection. This includes tracking elevation requests, unusual sign-in patterns, and unauthorized privilege escalations.

actions.actionTitle: Automate investigation and response activities
actions.actionDescription: Enable automated investigation and response (AIR) capabilities in Microsoft 365 Defender to automatically investigate alerts and remediate threats. This reduces the time to detect and respond to security incidents while maintaining audit trails of all automated actions.

actions.actionTitle: Create removable storage groups
actions.actionDescription: Define and manage groups of removable storage devices in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to control USB and external storage access. This allows granular control over which removable devices can be used in your environment based on device properties or manufacturer.

actions.actionTitle: Provide privacy information for organizations
actions.actionDescription: Configure and display privacy notices, consent forms, and data handling policies to comply with privacy regulations. This includes setting up privacy statements in Azure AD, Microsoft 365, and other services to inform users about data collection and processing practices.

actions.actionTitle: Manage Mobile Device Management (MDM) Devices remotely
actions.actionDescription: Implement remote management capabilities for mobile devices through Microsoft Intune, including remote wipe, lock, and password reset. This ensures administrators can protect corporate data on lost or stolen devices and maintain security compliance.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy
actions.actionDescription: Develop and deploy device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune that define minimum security requirements for devices accessing corporate resources. These policies enforce settings like encryption, OS versions, and threat protection to maintain organizational security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Limit the use of administrative role access
actions.actionDescription: Implement just-in-time (JIT) administrative access through Azure AD Privileged Identity Management to minimize standing administrative privileges. This includes requiring approval and justification for privilege elevation and automatically removing access after a specified time period.

actions.actionTitle: Block legacy authentication
actions.actionDescription: Configure Conditional Access policies in Azure AD to block authentication protocols that don't support modern authentication methods like multi-factor authentication. This prevents attacks that exploit legacy protocols such as POP, SMTP, IMAP, and MAPI.

actions.actionTitle: Configure endpoint security solution integration
actions.actionDescription: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with third-party security solutions through APIs and connectors. This enables centralized security management and correlation of threat intelligence across multiple security platforms.

actions.actionTitle: Integrate form-based authentication applications into a central identity and access management engine
actions.actionDescription: Configure Azure AD Application Proxy to provide single sign-on (SSO) for legacy applications using form-based authentication. This centralizes authentication management and enables modern security controls for applications that don't natively support SAML or OAuth.

actions.actionTitle: Disable autoplay for all drives
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy or Intune policies to disable AutoPlay and AutoRun features for all drive types including USB, CD/DVD, and network drives. This prevents malware from automatically executing when removable media is connected to managed devices.

actions.actionTitle: Govern calendar sharing
actions.actionDescription: Establish policies in Exchange Online to control how users can share their calendar information internally and externally. This includes setting default sharing levels, restricting external sharing, and managing calendar publishing to prevent information disclosure.

actions.actionTitle: Employ a secure channel between the Domain Controller and member computers
actions.actionDescription: Configure secure channel communications between domain controllers and member computers using Kerberos and LDAP signing. This ensures authentication traffic is encrypted and protected from man-in-the-middle attacks in hybrid Azure AD environments.

actions.actionTitle: Enable multi-factor authentication for admins
actions.actionDescription: Require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all administrative accounts through Azure AD Conditional Access policies. This provides an additional layer of security for privileged accounts that have access to sensitive resources and configuration settings.

actions.actionTitle: Enable remote help for your tenant
actions.actionDescription: Activate Microsoft Remote Help capabilities at the tenant level to allow secure remote assistance sessions. This feature enables IT support to provide help while maintaining compliance with security policies and audit requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Disable basic authentication for remotely managed clients
actions.actionDescription: Block basic authentication methods for remote management protocols in Exchange Online and other services. This forces the use of modern authentication methods that support MFA and reduces the risk of credential theft through intercepted plain-text passwords.

actions.actionTitle: Enable endpoint detection (EDR) and response in block mode
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender for Endpoint's EDR in block mode to provide protection even when a third-party antivirus is the primary solution. This enables behavioral blocking and containment capabilities that can stop advanced threats missed by traditional antivirus.

actions.actionTitle: Generate remote connection report for cloud desktops
actions.actionDescription: Create reports on remote desktop connections to Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365 Cloud PCs. These reports help monitor user access patterns, identify potential security issues, and ensure compliance with remote access policies.

actions.actionTitle: Deploy security baseline policy
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft security baselines through Intune to apply recommended security configurations to Windows devices. These baselines include pre-configured settings for Windows security features, browser configurations, and Office applications based on Microsoft best practices.

actions.actionTitle: Discover and manage trends in shadow IT application usage
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps to discover and analyze shadow IT usage patterns across your organization. This includes identifying unsanctioned cloud applications, assessing their risk levels, and tracking adoption trends to make informed decisions about application governance.

actions.actionTitle: Enable deletion of an existing user
actions.actionDescription: Configure proper user deprovisioning workflows in Azure AD to ensure complete removal of user access when employees leave the organization. This includes automating account deletion, license reclamation, and data retention processes to maintain security and compliance.

actions.actionTitle: Log off idle sessions
actions.actionDescription: Implement automatic session termination for idle users in remote desktop services and cloud applications. This security control prevents unauthorized access to unattended sessions and ensures proper session management across virtual desktop infrastructure.

actions.actionTitle: Enable multi-factor authentication for non-administrative users
actions.actionDescription: Extend multi-factor authentication requirements to all user accounts through Azure AD Conditional Access or Security Defaults. This provides comprehensive protection against password-based attacks and ensures all users contribute to organizational security posture.

actions.actionTitle: Remove the learning period for alerts
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender security products to immediately generate alerts without a learning period for newly onboarded devices or users. This ensures that security monitoring begins immediately rather than waiting for baseline behavior to be established.

actions.actionTitle: Use tamper protection to protect security settings
actions.actionDescription: Enable tamper protection in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to prevent malicious apps and unauthorized users from changing important security settings. This protects antivirus configurations, real-time protection, and other critical security features from being disabled.

actions.actionTitle: Deny account elevation requests from standard user accounts
actions.actionDescription: Configure User Account Control (UAC) and Azure AD policies to prevent standard users from elevating privileges without proper authorization. This ensures that administrative tasks require explicit approval from designated administrators.

actions.actionTitle: Establish lockout mechanism in macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure account lockout policies for macOS devices managed through Intune to prevent brute force attacks. This includes setting maximum failed login attempts and lockout duration to protect against unauthorized access attempts.

actions.actionTitle: Disable 'Insecure guest logons' in Server Message Block (SMB)
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy or Intune settings to block insecure guest authentication to SMB shares. This prevents credential relay attacks and ensures that all SMB connections require proper authentication and encryption.

actions.actionTitle: Set cloud-based anti-phishing and anti-malware app
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender for Office 365's anti-phishing and anti-malware policies to protect email communications. This includes setting up Safe Attachments, Safe Links, and impersonation protection to detect and block advanced email threats.

actions.actionTitle: Restrict anonymous access to named pipes and shares
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows security settings to prevent anonymous access to named pipes and network shares. This blocks unauthorized enumeration of shared resources and prevents information disclosure through null session connections.

actions.actionTitle: Require additional authentication at startup
actions.actionDescription: Enable BitLocker pre-boot authentication or Windows Hello for Business to require additional verification before the operating system loads. This provides protection against offline attacks and ensures device security even when physically compromised.

actions.actionTitle: Import physical badging data
actions.actionDescription: Integrate physical access control system data with Azure AD Identity Protection to correlate physical and digital access patterns. This helps detect impossible travel scenarios and potential security breaches by comparing badge-in locations with sign-in locations.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy for Windows devices
actions.actionDescription: Establish comprehensive compliance policies in Microsoft Intune specifically for Windows devices, including requirements for BitLocker encryption, Windows Defender status, and minimum OS versions. Non-compliant devices can be blocked from accessing corporate resources.

actions.actionTitle: Disable the local storage of passwords and credentials
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows Credential Manager and browser settings to prevent local caching of passwords and credentials. This reduces the risk of credential theft from compromised devices and forces authentication requests to be processed in real-time.

actions.actionTitle: Restrict access to privileged accounts
actions.actionDescription: Implement strict access controls for privileged accounts using Azure AD Conditional Access and Privileged Identity Management. This includes requiring specific device compliance, location restrictions, and additional authentication factors for administrative access.

actions.actionTitle: Display privacy statements for end users
actions.actionDescription: Configure terms of use and privacy notices in Azure AD that users must acknowledge before accessing applications. This ensures users are informed about data handling practices and provides documented consent for compliance requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Disable password storage in web browser
actions.actionDescription: Deploy policies through Intune or Group Policy to prevent web browsers from saving passwords locally. This forces users to use enterprise password managers or authentication systems and prevents credentials from being stored in less secure browser storage.

actions.actionTitle: Maintain segregation of duties
actions.actionDescription: Design and enforce role-based access control (RBAC) in Azure AD to ensure proper separation of administrative duties. This prevents single individuals from having excessive permissions and reduces the risk of insider threats or accidental misconfigurations.

actions.actionTitle: Manage software update policies on macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure and enforce software update policies for macOS devices through Microsoft Intune. This includes scheduling OS updates, managing app updates, and ensuring critical security patches are applied within defined timeframes.

actions.actionTitle: Protect and manage local admin passwords for domain joined computers
actions.actionDescription: Implement Local Administrator Password Solution (LAPS) or Azure AD-based password management to automatically manage and rotate local administrator passwords. This ensures unique, complex passwords for local admin accounts and provides controlled access when needed.

actions.actionTitle: Route traffic through managed network access points
actions.actionDescription: Configure VPN or Azure AD Application Proxy to ensure remote access traffic flows through managed and monitored network endpoints. This provides visibility into remote connections and enables security controls for traffic accessing corporate resources.

actions.actionTitle: Enable 'Hide Option to Enable or Disable Updates'
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows Update settings through Group Policy or Intune to remove user ability to defer or disable updates. This ensures that security updates and patches are applied according to organizational policy without user intervention.

actions.actionTitle: Disallow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows security settings to prevent anonymous users from enumerating Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts and shares. This blocks reconnaissance activities that could be used to identify user accounts and system resources for targeted attacks.

actions.actionTitle: Utilize sensitivity labels for data restriction
actions.actionDescription: Implement Microsoft Information Protection sensitivity labels to classify and protect sensitive data across documents, emails, and collaboration platforms. These labels enforce encryption, access restrictions, and visual markings based on data classification levels.

actions.actionTitle: Require mobile devices to use encryption
actions.actionDescription: Enforce device encryption requirements through Intune compliance policies for all mobile devices accessing corporate data. This ensures that data stored on mobile devices is protected even if the device is lost or stolen.

actions.actionTitle: Restrict access to private keys
actions.actionDescription: Implement controls to protect cryptographic private keys using Azure Key Vault or Windows certificate stores with restricted permissions. This ensures that only authorized applications and users can access sensitive cryptographic material.

actions.actionTitle: Block Flash activation in Office documents
actions.actionDescription: Configure Office application settings to prevent Flash content from running in documents. This mitigates security risks associated with Flash vulnerabilities and reduces the attack surface for malicious content embedded in Office files.

actions.actionTitle: Search the audit log in compliance portal
actions.actionDescription: Regularly search and analyze unified audit logs in the Microsoft 365 compliance center to investigate security incidents and monitor administrative activities. This provides visibility into user actions, configuration changes, and potential security breaches.

actions.actionTitle: Block executable content from email client and webmail
actions.actionDescription: Configure mail flow rules and attachment policies in Exchange Online to block potentially dangerous file types from email. This prevents delivery of executable files, scripts, and other high-risk attachments that could contain malware.

actions.actionTitle: Configure a privileged access policy
actions.actionDescription: Establish privileged access management policies in Microsoft 365 to require approval for administrative tasks. This adds an additional layer of control and oversight for sensitive operations that could impact security or compliance.

actions.actionTitle: Audit user account status
actions.actionDescription: Implement regular reviews of user account status including active, disabled, and orphaned accounts in Azure AD. This helps identify accounts that should be deactivated and ensures proper account lifecycle management.

actions.actionTitle: Configure and validate network connections
actions.actionDescription: Set up and verify network connectivity requirements for Microsoft 365 services including proper DNS configuration, firewall rules, and proxy settings. Regular validation ensures optimal performance and security of cloud service connections.

actions.actionTitle: Use an anti-exploit tool
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Defender Exploit Guard to provide exploit protection for applications and processes. This includes configuring exploit protection mitigations that help protect against memory-based attacks and zero-day exploits.

actions.actionTitle: Prevent unauthorized access to systems that require user log-in
actions.actionDescription: Implement screen lock policies and automatic workstation locking through Group Policy or Intune. This ensures that unattended workstations are automatically secured to prevent unauthorized access to logged-in user sessions.

actions.actionTitle: Set up Sender Policy Framework to prevent spoofing
actions.actionDescription: Configure SPF records in DNS to specify authorized email servers for your domains. This email authentication method helps prevent spoofing and improves email deliverability by allowing recipients to verify sender authenticity.

actions.actionTitle: Use password hash sync in hybrid environments
actions.actionDescription: Enable password hash synchronization between on-premises Active Directory and Azure AD in hybrid deployments. This provides a backup authentication method and enables cloud-based security features like leaked credential detection.

actions.actionTitle: Add an on-premises application for remote access through application proxy
actions.actionDescription: Configure Azure AD Application Proxy to provide secure remote access to on-premises web applications. This eliminates the need for VPN connections while providing modern authentication and conditional access controls.

actions.actionTitle: Implement outbound spam policy
actions.actionDescription: Configure outbound spam filters in Exchange Online Protection to detect and block spam originating from your organization. This protects your domain reputation and prevents compromised accounts from sending malicious emails.

actions.actionTitle: Protect data in transit using encryption
actions.actionDescription: Enforce TLS encryption for all data transmissions including email, file transfers, and API communications. This includes configuring minimum TLS versions and cipher suites to ensure strong encryption for data in transit.

actions.actionTitle: Block Office applications from injecting code into other processes
actions.actionDescription: Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to prevent Office applications from injecting code into other processes. This blocks a common technique used by malware to gain persistence and evade detection.

actions.actionTitle: Block execution of potentially obfuscated scripts
actions.actionDescription: Enable Attack Surface Reduction rules to detect and block scripts that appear to be obfuscated or suspicious. This prevents execution of PowerShell, JavaScript, and VBScript code that uses obfuscation techniques common in malware.

actions.actionTitle: Detect and remediate illicit access consent grants
actions.actionDescription: Monitor and investigate OAuth consent grants in Azure AD to identify potentially malicious applications. Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps to detect abnormal consent patterns and revoke suspicious application permissions.

actions.actionTitle: Review diagnostic data to verify that anti-malware software is deployed and up-to-date
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft Endpoint Manager and security reporting to verify antimalware deployment status and definition updates across all devices. Regular review ensures protection is active and current on all endpoints.

actions.actionTitle: Protect Windows devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy comprehensive protection for Windows devices using Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, including real-time protection, behavioral monitoring, and cloud-delivered protection. This provides multi-layered defense against malware, ransomware, and advanced persistent threats.

actions.actionTitle: Block untrusted and unsigned processes that run from USB
actions.actionDescription: Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules to prevent execution of untrusted and unsigned executables from USB drives. This mitigates risks from malware spread through removable media and prevents unauthorized software installation.

actions.actionTitle: Schedule threat scans for Mac
actions.actionDescription: Configure scheduled antivirus scans for macOS devices using Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. Regular scanning ensures thorough detection of dormant threats and maintains security hygiene on Mac endpoints.

actions.actionTitle: Use advanced protection against ransomware
actions.actionDescription: Enable controlled folder access and other anti-ransomware features in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. This protects important folders from unauthorized changes and blocks ransomware from encrypting files in protected locations.

actions.actionTitle: Review malware and non-malware reports
actions.actionDescription: Regularly analyze threat detection reports from Microsoft 365 Defender to understand malware trends and false positive patterns. This helps optimize security policies and improve threat response strategies.

actions.actionTitle: Enable controlled folder access
actions.actionDescription: Activate controlled folder access in Windows Defender to protect valuable data from malicious apps and ransomware. This feature monitors apps attempting to make changes to files in protected folders and blocks unauthorized modifications.

actions.actionTitle: Enforce immediate temporary password change
actions.actionDescription: Configure Azure AD to require immediate password changes for temporary or first-time passwords. This ensures users create their own secure passwords and prevents unauthorized access through known temporary credentials.

actions.actionTitle: Use the system clock to generate time stamps for audit records
actions.actionDescription: Ensure all systems synchronize with authoritative time sources using NTP to maintain accurate timestamps in audit logs. This is critical for forensic analysis, correlation of security events, and compliance requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Require mobile devices to use a password
actions.actionDescription: Enforce password or PIN requirements on all mobile devices through Intune compliance policies. This basic security control prevents unauthorized access to corporate data on mobile devices and ensures minimum authentication standards.

actions.actionTitle: Create and publish sensitivity label policies for content in relevant sites and applications
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Information Protection label policies to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams to ensure consistent data classification. These policies automatically apply labels based on content and enforce protection settings across collaboration platforms.

actions.actionTitle: Investigate insider risk management alerts
actions.actionDescription: Review and investigate alerts from Microsoft 365 Insider Risk Management to identify potential data theft, leaks, or policy violations by internal users. This includes analyzing user activity patterns and taking appropriate remediation actions.

actions.actionTitle: Create a Windows 10 app protection policy
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows Information Protection (WIP) policies through Intune to protect corporate data in Windows 10 apps. This prevents accidental data leaks by controlling how users can copy, save, and share business information.

actions.actionTitle: Enable ability to remotely wipe data from mobile devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure selective wipe capabilities in Microsoft Intune to remove corporate data from lost or stolen devices while preserving personal information. This ensures business data protection without completely wiping personal devices in BYOD scenarios.

actions.actionTitle: Block Adobe Reader from creating child processes
actions.actionDescription: Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules to prevent Adobe Reader from spawning child processes. This blocks a common exploitation technique where PDF malware attempts to launch malicious processes through Adobe Reader.

actions.actionTitle: Protect important folders with controlled folder access
actions.actionDescription: Configure controlled folder access to protect Documents, Pictures, Videos, and Desktop folders by default from ransomware and untrusted applications. Additional custom folders containing critical business data can be added for protection.

actions.actionTitle: Set account lockout threshold to 5 or lower in macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure macOS device policies through Intune to lock user accounts after 5 or fewer failed login attempts. This protects against brute force password attacks while balancing security with user experience.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy for Android devices
actions.actionDescription: Establish device compliance requirements for Android devices including minimum OS version, encryption, and threat protection. Non-compliant devices can be blocked from accessing corporate resources until they meet security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Block non-compliant devices and report policy violations
actions.actionDescription: Configure Conditional Access policies to block non-compliant devices from accessing corporate resources and generate reports on compliance violations. This enforces security standards and provides visibility into device compliance status.

actions.actionTitle: Keep antivirus definitions for macOS devices up to date
actions.actionDescription: Configure automatic definition updates for Microsoft Defender on macOS devices to ensure protection against the latest threats. This includes setting update frequency and managing update channels for timely protection.

actions.actionTitle: Investigate compromised mailboxes
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft 365 security tools to detect and investigate signs of mailbox compromise including unusual login patterns, mail forwarding rules, and mass deletions. This helps identify breached accounts and assess the scope of potential data exposure.

actions.actionTitle: Facilitate the investigation of compromised user account mailboxes
actions.actionDescription: Implement mailbox auditing and investigation tools in Microsoft 365 to streamline forensic analysis of compromised accounts. This includes enabling unified audit logs, configuring retention policies, and using advanced hunting queries to trace malicious activities.

actions.actionTitle: Establish access reviews for high privileged roles
actions.actionDescription: Configure periodic access reviews in Azure AD Privileged Identity Management for administrative and high-privilege roles. This ensures that elevated permissions are regularly validated and removed when no longer needed.

actions.actionTitle: Create and deploy data loss prevention policies
actions.actionDescription: Implement Microsoft 365 DLP policies to identify, monitor, and protect sensitive information across Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams. These policies prevent unauthorized sharing of confidential data and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

actions.actionTitle: Review cloud traffic logs for ongoing visibility
actions.actionDescription: Analyze Microsoft Cloud App Security and Azure network traffic logs to monitor data flows and identify anomalous patterns. Regular review helps detect shadow IT, data exfiltration attempts, and unusual user behavior.

actions.actionTitle: Disable 'Always install with elevated privileges'
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy or Intune to prevent Windows Installer from using elevated privileges for standard user installations. This prevents privilege escalation attacks through malicious MSI packages.

actions.actionTitle: Protect authenticators
actions.actionDescription: Implement protection for authentication tokens, certificates, and other authenticators using Azure Key Vault and credential management policies. This includes securing storage, rotation, and access controls for authentication materials.

actions.actionTitle: Enforce authenticators strength and complexity
actions.actionDescription: Configure password policies and authentication strength requirements in Azure AD to enforce minimum complexity, length, and history requirements. This ensures all authentication methods meet organizational security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Create and manage device tags and groups
actions.actionDescription: Organize devices in Microsoft Intune using tags and dynamic groups for efficient policy deployment and management. This enables targeted configuration and compliance policies based on device characteristics or ownership.

actions.actionTitle: Enable 'MIME Sniffing Safety Feature'
actions.actionDescription: Configure Internet Explorer and Edge security settings to prevent MIME type sniffing attacks. This blocks browsers from executing content with incorrect MIME types, preventing cross-site scripting and other content-type confusion attacks.

actions.actionTitle: Restrict access to audit information
actions.actionDescription: Implement role-based access controls to limit who can view and export audit logs in Microsoft 365 and Azure. This ensures that sensitive audit information is only accessible to authorized security and compliance personnel.

actions.actionTitle: Set 'Remote Desktop security level' to 'TLS'
actions.actionDescription: Configure Remote Desktop Services to use TLS encryption for all connections. This ensures that RDP sessions are encrypted and protected from man-in-the-middle attacks and eavesdropping.

actions.actionTitle: Prevent use of unauthorized software and cloud apps
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps and Intune app protection policies to block unauthorized applications and cloud services. This includes creating app blacklists and using Cloud Discovery to identify and restrict shadow IT.

actions.actionTitle: Create customized or use default DLP policies for endpoints
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Endpoint DLP to extend data loss prevention capabilities to Windows 10 devices. This monitors and blocks sensitive data transfers through removable storage, clipboard, printing, and other endpoint activities.

actions.actionTitle: Disable SMBv1 client driver
actions.actionDescription: Remove or disable the SMBv1 protocol on all Windows systems to prevent exploitation of known vulnerabilities. SMBv1 is deprecated and has multiple security flaws that have been exploited in ransomware attacks.

actions.actionTitle: Use boundary protection to limit access to services based on the location of the client
actions.actionDescription: Implement location-based Conditional Access policies in Azure AD to restrict access to services from specific geographic locations. This prevents access from high-risk countries and enforces geographic boundaries for sensitive resources.

actions.actionTitle: Perform real-time threat detection
actions.actionDescription: Enable real-time protection in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to continuously monitor and respond to threats. This provides immediate detection and blocking of malware, exploits, and suspicious behaviors as they occur.

actions.actionTitle: Govern managed apps
actions.actionDescription: Implement Microsoft Intune app protection policies to control how corporate data is handled within managed applications. This includes restricting copy/paste, preventing backups, and requiring app-level PIN authentication.

actions.actionTitle: Disable 'Autoplay for non-volume devices'
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows settings to disable AutoPlay for MTP devices like cameras and phones. This prevents automatic execution of potentially malicious content from non-traditional storage devices.

actions.actionTitle: View the timeline of risky events
actions.actionDescription: Use Azure AD Identity Protection and Microsoft 365 Defender timeline views to investigate the sequence of risky events and security incidents. This helps understand attack patterns and the progression of security breaches.

actions.actionTitle: Disable SMBv1 server support
actions.actionDescription: Disable the SMBv1 server component on all Windows systems to prevent hosting of vulnerable SMB shares. This eliminates the attack surface for SMBv1 exploits while maintaining support for modern SMB protocols.

actions.actionTitle: Add boundary protection by preventing users from browsing untrusted sites
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender SmartScreen and Application Guard to isolate browsing sessions to untrusted websites. This creates a container-based boundary that prevents web-based threats from affecting the host system.

actions.actionTitle: Prohibit use of Internet Connection Sharing on your DNS domain network
actions.actionDescription: Disable Internet Connection Sharing (ICS) through Group Policy to prevent users from creating unauthorized network bridges. This prevents security bypass and ensures all network traffic flows through managed security controls.

actions.actionTitle: Disable Solicited Remote Assistance
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy to disable Solicited Remote Assistance to prevent users from inviting external help that could bypass security controls. This ensures all remote support goes through approved IT channels with proper authentication.

actions.actionTitle: View device health and compliance reports
actions.actionDescription: Generate and review comprehensive device health reports in Microsoft Endpoint Manager to monitor compliance status, security posture, and update compliance. These reports provide insights for maintaining organizational device security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Use automated investigation and remediation capabilities
actions.actionDescription: Enable Automated Investigation and Response (AIR) in Microsoft 365 Defender to automatically investigate alerts and remediate common threats. This reduces response time for security incidents and ensures consistent remediation actions.

actions.actionTitle: Install a configuration profile on your iOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy iOS configuration profiles through Intune to enforce security settings, WiFi configurations, and email settings. These profiles ensure consistent security configuration across all managed iOS devices.

actions.actionTitle: Disallow password reuse on mobile devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure password history requirements in Intune to prevent users from reusing previous passwords on mobile devices. This ensures password changes result in genuinely new credentials and reduces the risk of compromised password reuse.

actions.actionTitle: Enable software installation policies in macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure macOS device restrictions through Intune to control software installation sources and require administrator approval. This prevents installation of unauthorized or malicious software on corporate Mac devices.

actions.actionTitle: Manage security related incidents
actions.actionDescription: Implement incident management processes using Microsoft 365 Defender and Azure Sentinel to track, investigate, and respond to security incidents. This includes establishing workflows for incident classification, investigation, and remediation.

actions.actionTitle: Send security and health alerts to syslog server
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and other security services to forward alerts to a syslog server or SIEM. This enables centralized security monitoring and integration with third-party security operations platforms.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy for iOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Establish iOS-specific compliance requirements in Intune including jailbreak detection, minimum OS version, and security settings. Non-compliant devices are blocked from accessing corporate resources until they meet defined standards.

actions.actionTitle: Enable peer-to-peer encryption for sending digitally signed and encrypted messages
actions.actionDescription: Configure S/MIME or Microsoft Information Protection for end-to-end email encryption. This ensures sensitive communications are encrypted and digitally signed for authenticity and confidentiality between specific recipients.

actions.actionTitle: Use role-based privileged account management
actions.actionDescription: Implement Azure AD Privileged Identity Management with role-based access controls to manage and monitor privileged accounts. This includes just-in-time access, approval workflows, and time-bound privilege elevation.

actions.actionTitle: Review the software inventory
actions.actionDescription: Regularly review software inventory reports from Microsoft Endpoint Manager to identify unauthorized, outdated, or vulnerable applications. This helps maintain approved software lists and identify shadow IT installations.

actions.actionTitle: Protect data at rest with application-layer encryption
actions.actionDescription: Implement Azure Information Protection and Microsoft 365 encryption to protect data at the application layer. This provides persistent protection that travels with the data regardless of storage location or transmission method.

actions.actionTitle: Review and approve remediation actions in risk-based Vulnerability Management software
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management to review identified vulnerabilities and approve remediation actions. This includes prioritizing patches based on risk scores and tracking remediation progress across the environment.

actions.actionTitle: Install a configuration profile on your Android enterprise devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Android Enterprise configuration profiles through Intune to manage work profile settings, app configurations, and security policies. This ensures consistent security configuration and separation of work and personal data.

actions.actionTitle: Enable automatic enrollment of corporate-owned iOS and iPadOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager integration with Intune for zero-touch enrollment of corporate iOS devices. This streamlines device deployment while ensuring immediate application of security policies.

actions.actionTitle: Protect mobile and desktop applications
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Intune app protection policies to secure corporate data within applications on both managed and unmanaged devices. This includes encryption, copy/paste restrictions, and selective wipe capabilities for business data.

actions.actionTitle: Configure an endpoint solution for iOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Defender for Endpoint on iOS devices to provide threat protection, web protection, and jailbreak detection. This extends enterprise security capabilities to iOS endpoints in your mobile device fleet.

actions.actionTitle: Create complex passwords on mobile devices
actions.actionDescription: Enforce complex password requirements on mobile devices through Intune compliance policies, including minimum length, character types, and complexity rules. This ensures mobile device passwords meet organizational security standards for accessing corporate resources.
